intro: Elatostema sinuatum var. acuminatissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false shamrock, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive sinuate margin and elongated lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
